vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in patch_8.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.13 (patch_8.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Centra4.transfer (patch_8.sol#4-18):
	-require(bool)(contract_address.call(bytes4(keccak256()(register(string))),CentraToken)) patch_8.sol#14
	-require(bool)(contract_address.call(bytes4(keccak256()(transfer(address,uint256))),c2,k)) patch_8.sol#15

vulnerability_findings.name: Multiple Calls in a Single Transaction (SWC 113)
vulnerability_findings.message:
Multiple calls are executed in the same transaction.
This call is executed following another call within the same transaction. It is possible that the call never gets executed if a prior call fails permanently. This might be caused intentionally by a malicious callee. If possible, refactor the code such that each transaction only executes one external call or make sure that all callees can be trusted (i.e. they’re part of your own codebase).
Classification: SWC-113
